item.title: Need help with linux
item.dc:creator: @tyb97 tyb97
item.description:
@tyb97 wrote:

[quote=“HcoJustin, post:3, topic:546396”]Linux shell scripts are a little different. @echo off or any title/pause command won’t work. And for separating entries on the class path you want to use : as ; is reserved in most shells. I also don’t think the wildcard works for the java classpath so you’ll want to manually list them out.

We end up with:

This and just as a heads up, Linux is case-sensitive, so if some of the path strings in your source carelessly ignore this issue, you’ll have file not found exceptions all over the place.

Kind Regards.
DemonWars.

Read full topic

item.title: Need help with linux
item.dc:creator: @DemonWars DemonWars
item.description:
@DemonWars wrote:

Do you have Java installed?
if so, you should re-direct where Java is installed.
Since LinuX does not have the same directory orginization system as windows does.

Kind Regards.
DemonWars.

Read full topic

item.title: Need help with linux
item.dc:creator: @mortl_dragon mortl dragon
item.description:
@mortl_dragon wrote:

I need help with getting my run.rar set to linux centOS06 i have the basic run here it is

@echo off
title Server
"C:/Program Files/Java/jre7/bin/java.exe" -Xmx512m -cp bin;lib/*; com.rs.Launcher true true false
pause

If you can help that would be great!

Read full topic
